title: Futures point to Dow opening more than 300 points lower amid US-China trade turmoil
text: Futures on Sunday evening pointed to an opening decline of more than 300 points for the Dow Jones Industrial Average at Monday's open.

title: Asian stocks skid to six-and-a-half-month lows as Sino-U.S. trade row shakes markets
text: Asian shares slid to 6-1/2-month lows on Monday and the yuan plunged as a rapid escalation in the Sino-U.S. trade war drove nervous investors to safe-havens such as the yen, bonds and gold.

title: Huawei tests smartphone with own operating system, possibly for sale this year: Chinese state media
text: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd is testing a smartphone equipped with Hongmeng, the company's self-developed operating system, which could potentially go on sale by the end of this year, Chinese state-media outlet Global Times reported.

title: It's not just the trade war – these global fears could put stocks through the wringer
text: The U.S.-China trade war is spooking Wall Street, but Phil Orlando of Federated Investors says that's not the only hurdle ahead.

title: Trump reportedly overruled advisors in decision to slap tariffs on remaining Chinese imports
text: Virtually everyone present at an Oval Office meeting objected to Trump's decision to impose additional tariffs, according to The Wall Street Journal. O

title: Stocks Are Doing Just Fine, Kinda.
text: Most folks don’t like a 3% weekly loss like we saw this past week in the S&P, but the market is holding up fine. For now.

title: Major Averages Close Below Key Levels Marking Considerable Downside Risk
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average, S and P 500, Dow Jones Transports and Russell 2000 ended last week below semiannual pivots.

title: Easy Money Won't Save The Global Economy From The Next Recession
text: Interest rate cuts didn’t save the global economy from sliding into a recession before, and they won’t do it this time around either.

title: Stormy Markets Reveal Great Managers
text: Wayne Himelsein says its easier to find great stocks in choppy markets than in bull markets and uses his recent purchase of MarketAxess Holdings (MKTX) to explain.

title: The Week Ahead: How Low Will New Tariffs Take The Stock Market?
text: As has frequently been the case the stock market started its roller coaster ride after remarks from Fed Chair Powell during his news conference. The Trump Tweet the next day added to investor’s pain but what does that mean for stocks in August?

title: IPO Outlook For The Week: Beauty Treatments, Banking and Liver Therapy
text: For a more comprehensive IPO calendar, check out the offering in Benzinga Cloud. The IPO dates below are expected but not confirmed.

title: Japan, U.S. target broad bilateral trade deal by September: Nikkei
text: Japan and the United States have agreed to target a broad deal on bilateral trade by September, seeking to bridge differences of opinion over tariffs on beef and the automobile sector, the Nikkei business daily reported on Sunday.
